sen.j: 中川 淳庵（なかがわ じゅんあん/じゅんなん、元文4年（1739年） - 天明6年6月7日 (旧暦)（1786年7月2日）は江戸時代中期の医者・本草学者・蘭学者。
sen.e: Junan NAKAGAWA (1739 – July 2, 1786) was a doctor, herbalist and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) active in the middle of the Edo period.
Junan NAKAGAWA (1739 – July 2, 1786) was a doctor, herbalist and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) active in the middle of the Edo period.
Junan NAKAGAWA (1739 – July 2, 1786) was a doctor, herbalist and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) active in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: はじめ純安と名乗る。
sen.e: Initially, Junan淳庵 was written as Junan純安 (it can be also pronounced Sumiyasu).
Initially, Junan淳庵 was written as Junan純安 (it can be also pronounced Sumiyasu).
Initially, Junan淳庵 was written as Junan純安 (it can be also pronounced Sumiyasu).

sen.j: 名は鱗（りん）もしくは玄鱗。
sen.e: His real name was Rin or Genrin.
His real name was Rin or Genrin.
His real name was Rin or Genrin.

sen.j: 字は攀卿。
sen.e: After grew up, he called himself Hankei.
After grew up, he called himself Hankei.
After grew up, he called himself Hankei.

sen.j: 若狭国小浜藩の蘭方医であり、杉田玄白の後輩にあたる。
sen.e: He served the Obama clan of Wakasa Province as a doctor, especially as Ranpoi (a doctor who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language); Genpaku SUGITA is known very well as an older Ranpoi.

He served the Obama clan of Wakasa Province as a doctor, especially as Ranpoi (a doctor who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language); Genpaku SUGITA is known very well as an older Ranpoi.

He served the Obama clan of Wakasa Province as a doctor, especially as Ranpoi (a doctor who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language); Genpaku SUGITA is known very well as an older Ranpoi.

sen.j: 前野良沢・杉田玄白とともに『解体新書』を翻訳した。
sen.e: Junan cooperated with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA to translate "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy).
Junan cooperated with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA to translate "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy).
Junan cooperated with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA to translate "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy).

sen.j: 向学心と積極性に富み、多くの学者と交わり、蘭学の発展に貢献する。
sen.e: He was endowed with great interest in learning and forwardness, and played an important role to develop the Western medical science in Japan through cooperating with many scientists and doctors.
He was endowed with great interest in learning and forwardness, and played an important role to develop the Western medical science in Japan through cooperating with many scientists and doctors.
He was endowed with great interest in learning and forwardness, and played an important role to develop the Western medical science in Japan through cooperating with many scientists and doctors.

sen.j: 祖父の代から小浜藩の蘭方医を勤めた家系という。
sen.e: Originally, Junan's grandfather began to serve the Obama clan as Ranpoi.
Originally, Junan's grandfather began to serve the Obama clan as Ranpoi.
Originally, Junan's grandfather began to serve the Obama clan as Ranpoi.

sen.j: 江戸麹町に住んでいた。
sen.e: Junan resided in Kojimachi (the district for the residences of local statesmen) of Edo (present Tokyo).
Junan resided in Kojimachi (the district for the residences of local statesmen) of Edo (present Tokyo).
Junan resided in Kojimachi (the district for the residences of local statesmen) of Edo (present Tokyo).

sen.j: 山形藩医の安富寄碩にオランダ語を学び、本草学を田村藍水に学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned Dutch from a doctor of Yamagata Domain, Kiseki YASUTOMI, and learned herbalism from Ransui TAMURA.
sen.cmt: 安富寄碩Kiseki YASUTOMI田村藍水Ransui TAMURA
sen.e: He learned Dutch from a doctor of Yamagata Domain, Kiseki YASUTOMI, and learned herbalism from Ransui TAMURA.
He learned Dutch from a doctor of Yamagata Domain, Kiseki YASUTOMI, and learned herbalism from Ransui TAMURA.

sen.j: 1764年（明和元年）平賀源内と共に火浣布を造った。
sen.e: In 1764, he assisted Gennai HIRAGA in inventing kakanpu (asbestous cloth).
In 1764, he assisted Gennai HIRAGA in inventing kakanpu (asbestous cloth).
In 1764, he assisted Gennai HIRAGA in inventing kakanpu (asbestous cloth).

sen.j: オランダ物産についても興味を持ち、カピタン（オランダ商館長）が逗留した長崎屋源右衛門にしばしば訪問する。
sen.e: He was very interested in Dutch things and often visited Nagasaki-ya (its famous master's name was Genemon) where 'kapitan' (the curators of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki) were often staying.
He was very interested in Dutch things and often visited Nagasaki-ya (its famous master's name was Genemon) where kapitan (the curators of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki) were often staying.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションマークを削除しました。
sen.e: He was very interested in Dutch things and often visited Nagasaki-ya (its famous master's name was Genemon) where kapitan (the curators of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki) were often staying.

sen.j: 1771年（明和7年）杉田玄白らと共に『解体新書』翻訳に参加し、訳述に当たる。
sen.e: In 1771, he participated in the translation of "Kaitai Shinsho" as well as Genpaku SUGITA and others.
In 1771, he participated in the translation of "Kaitai Shinsho" as well as Genpaku SUGITA and others.
In 1771, he participated in the translation of "Kaitai Shinsho" as well as Genpaku SUGITA and others.

sen.j: その後もオランダ語の学習を続け、1776年（安永5年）、カール・ツンベルクとは植物学などや会話も行い、学んだという。
sen.e: Even after finished the translation, he kept learning Dutch; in 1776, he met a doctor of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki, Carl Thunberg, and learned herbalism and other things from him.
sen.cmt: カール・ツンベルクCarl Thunberg
sen.e: Even after finished the translation, he kept learning Dutch; in 1776, he met a doctor of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki, Carl Thunberg, and learned herbalism and other things from him.
Even after finished the translation, he kept learning Dutch; in 1776, he met a doctor of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki, Carl Thunberg, and learned herbalism and other things from him.

sen.j: 1778年（安永7年）若狭藩の奥医となって、1786年（天明6年）、膈症により死去。
sen.e: In 1778, he was appointed to Okuishi (doctor for lord and lord's family) of the Wakasa clan; in 1786, he died from kaku (an illness by which the patient can't take any food).
In 1778, he was appointed to Okuishi (doctor for lord and lord's family) of the Wakasa clan; in 1786, he died from kaku (an illness by which the patient can't take any food).
In 1778, he was appointed to Okuishi (doctor for lord and lord's family) of the Wakasa clan; in 1786, he died from kaku (an illness by which the patient can't take any food).

sen.j: 早くから本草学方面へ興味を持ち、田村藍水門下に学んだ。
sen.e: Since he was young, he had been interested in herbalism and learned it from Ransui TAMURA.
Since he was young, he had been interested in herbalism and learned it from Ransui TAMURA.
Since he was young, he had been interested in herbalism and learned it from Ransui TAMURA.

sen.j: 宝暦7年（1757年）の田村一門の物産会に参加。
sen.e: In 1757, he participated in a seminar on materials at Tamura school.
In 1757, he participated in a seminar on materials at Tamura school.
In 1757, he participated in a seminar on materials at Tamura school.

sen.j: 宝暦13年（1763年）、平賀源内発行の『物類品隲』（ぶつるいひんしつ）の校閲をしている。
sen.e: In 1763, he checked and corrected Gennai HIRAGA's "Butsurui hinshitsu" (Classification of Various Materials).
In 1763, he checked and corrected Gennai HIRAGA's "Butsurui hinshitsu" (Classification of Various Materials).
In 1763, he checked and corrected Gennai HIRAGA's "Butsurui hinshitsu" (Classification of Various Materials).

sen.j: 宝暦14年（1764年）の源内による火浣布創製、明和2年（1765年）の寒暖計にも協力したといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that he assisted Gennai in inventing kakanpu (asbestous cloth) in 1764 and kandankei (thermometer) in 1765.
It is said that he assisted Gennai in inventing kakanpu (asbestous cloth) in 1764 and kandankei (thermometer) in 1765.
It is said that he assisted Gennai in inventing kakanpu (asbestous cloth) in 1764 and kandankei (thermometer) in 1765.

sen.j: 平賀源内と杉田玄白の交友は有名だが、源内との関係は淳庵の方が長い可能性が高い。
sen.e: The friendship between Gennai HIRAGA and Genpaku SUGITA is known well, and Junan might have kept a longer friendship with Gennai.
The friendship between Gennai HIRAGA and Genpaku SUGITA is known well, and Junan might have kept a longer friendship with Gennai.
The friendship between Gennai HIRAGA and Genpaku SUGITA is known well, and Junan might have kept a longer friendship with Gennai.

sen.j: 安永5年（1776年）、博物学者ツンベリーが来都したときには、医学の他に植物標本作成法についても教えを受けている。
sen.e: In 1776 when a naturalist and doctor Thunberg came to Edo, Junan learned not only medical science but also a method for making specimens of vegetable from him.
In 1776 when a naturalist and doctor Thunberg came to Edo, Junan learned not only medical science but also a method for making specimens of vegetable from him.
In 1776 when a naturalist and doctor Thunberg came to Edo, Junan learned not only medical science but also a method for making specimens of vegetable from him.

tit.e: His achievements as a Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language)
His achievements as a Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language)
His achievements as a Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language)

sen.j: 『解体新書』以前
sen.e: Before "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy)
Before "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy)
Before "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy)

sen.j: 同町の安富奇碩（やすとみきせき）からオランダ文字（アルファベット）を使ったいろは四十七文字（一種のローマ字）を学んだ。
sen.e: Junan learned Dutch from Kiseki YASUTOMI who was living in Kojimachi too, through corresponding Dutch pronunciations to Iroha Shijushichi-moji (forty-seven Japanese syllables).
Junan learned Dutch from Kiseki YASUTOMI who was living in Kojimachi too, through corresponding Dutch pronunciations to Iroha Shijushichi-moji (forty-seven Japanese syllables).
Junan learned Dutch from Kiseki YASUTOMI who was living in Kojimachi too, through corresponding Dutch pronunciations to Iroha Shijushichi-moji (forty-seven Japanese syllables).

sen.j: また、しばしばカピタンの逗留する長崎屋に訪れている。
sen.e: He also often visited Nagasaki-ya where 'kapitan' (the curators of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki) were staying.
He also often visited Nagasaki-ya where kapitan (the curators of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki) were staying.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションマークを削除しました。
sen.e: He also often visited Nagasaki-ya where kapitan (the curators of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki) were staying.

sen.j: 『解体新書』翻訳
sen.e: Translation of "Kaitai Shinsho"
Translation of "Kaitai Shinsho"
Translation of "Kaitai Shinsho"

sen.j: 明和8年（1771年）、杉田玄白が『クルムス解剖書』（いわゆる『ターヘル・アナトミア』を入手する仲立ちをする。
sen.e: In 1771, Junan assisted Genpaku SUGITA in getting "Ontleedkundige Tafelen", a book of anatomy written by Kulmus.
In 1771, Junan assisted Genpaku SUGITA in getting "Ontleedkundige Tafelen", a book of anatomy written by Kulmus.
In 1771, Junan assisted Genpaku SUGITA in getting "Ontleedkundige Tafelen", a book of anatomy written by Kulmus.

sen.j: 同年小塚原刑場で腑分けに立ち会い、翌日から前野良沢・杉田玄白とともに翻訳作業を開始する。
sen.e: Within the same year, he participated in an anatomy at Kozukahara-keijo execution ground, and since the next day, he and Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA began to translate the book.
Within the same year, he participated in an anatomy at Kozukahara-keijo execution ground, and since the next day, he began to translate the book with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA.
sen.cmt: he and Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITAのように３人を2つのandでつなぐのは不自然なので、左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: Within the same year, he participated in an anatomy at Kozukahara-keijo execution ground, and since the next day, he began to translate the book with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA.

sen.j: 自らも『パルヘイン解体書』『バルシトス解体書』を所有していたことが『解体新書』に見える。
sen.e: According to "Kaitai Shinsho", Junan had other books of anatomy written by Barfein and by Barsitos.
sen.cmt: 『パルヘイン解体書』『バルシトス解体書』定訳不明
sen.e: According to "Kaitai Shinsho", Junan had other books of anatomy written by Barfein and by Barsitos.
According to "Kaitai Shinsho", Junan had other books of anatomy written by Barfein and by Barsitos.

sen.j: 安永2年（1773年）正月『解体約図』発行（校閲者として）。
sen.e: In January of 1773 (in old lunar calendar), they published "Kaitai Yakuzu" (Summary and Figures of Anatomy), and Junan's name was written as a proofreader.
In January of 1773 (in old lunar calendar), they published "Kaitai Yakuzu" (Summary and Figures of Anatomy), and Junan's name was written as a proofreader.
In January of 1773 (in old lunar calendar), they published "Kaitai Yakuzu" (Summary and Figures of Anatomy), and Junan's name was written as a proofreader.

sen.j: 安永3年（1774年）8月『解体新書』出版（校者として）。
sen.e: In August of 1774 (in old lunar calendar), they finally published "Kaitai Shinsho", and Junan's name was written as a proofreader as well.
In August of 1774 (in old lunar calendar), they finally published "Kaitai Shinsho", and Junan's name was written as a proofreader as well.
In August of 1774 (in old lunar calendar), they finally published "Kaitai Shinsho", and Junan's name was written as a proofreader as well.

sen.j: 『解体新書』以降
sen.e: After "Kaitai Shinsho"
After "Kaitai Shinsho"
After "Kaitai Shinsho"

sen.j: 『解体新書』上梓以降も前野良沢のもとでオランダ語の学習を進めた。
sen.e: Even after published "Kaitai Shinsho", Junan kept learning Dutch from Ryotaku MAENO.
Even after published "Kaitai Shinsho", Junan kept learning Dutch from Ryotaku MAENO.
Even after published "Kaitai Shinsho", Junan kept learning Dutch from Ryotaku MAENO.

sen.j: 安永5年（1776年）、桂川甫周とともに江戸参府中のツンベリーを訪ねる。
sen.e: In 1776, he and Hoshu KATSURAGAWA visited Thunberg who was staying in Edo.
In 1776, he and Hoshu KATSURAGAWA visited Thunberg who was staying in Edo.
In 1776, he and Hoshu KATSURAGAWA visited Thunberg who was staying in Edo.

sen.j: 医学・博物学について教えを受ける。
sen.e: He learned medical science and natural history from him.
He learned medical science and natural history from him.
He learned medical science and natural history from him.

sen.j: ツンベリーは、淳庵はかなりよくオランダ語を話すと記している。
sen.e: There remains Thunberg's remark about Junan, and according to it, Junan spoke Dutch very well.
There remains Thunberg's remark about Junan, and according to it, Junan spoke Dutch very well.
There remains Thunberg's remark about Junan, and according to it, Junan spoke Dutch very well.

sen.j: また、商館長イサーク・チチングへ宛てた手紙が現存しており、流麗な筆記体で書かれている。
sen.e: There also remains Junan's letter to a curator of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki, Isaac Titsingh, written in an elegant running hand.
sen.cmt: イサーク・チチングIsaac Titsingh
sen.e: There also remains Junan's letter to a curator of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki, Isaac Titsingh, written in an elegant running hand.
There also remains Junan's letter to a curator of the Dutch Trading House of Nagasaki, Isaac Titsingh, written in an elegant running hand.

sen.j: ただし岩崎克己（『前野蘭化』の著者）によると、格や活用についての理解は不十分であるとのこと。
sen.e: However, according to Katsumi IWASAKI (the writer of "Maeno Ranka"), Junan was not good at using cases and conjugations correctly.
sen.cmt: 岩崎克己Katsumi IWASAKI『前野蘭化』"Maeno Ranka"…書名
sen.e: However, according to Katsumi IWASAKI (the writer of "Maeno Ranka"), Junan was not good at using cases and conjugations correctly.
However, according to Katsumi IWASAKI (the writer of "Maeno Ranka"), Junan was not good at using cases and conjugations correctly.

sen.j: もっともこれは中川淳庵だけの問題ではなく、次世代の大槻玄沢においてもオランダ語の格・活用は完全に理解されていなかった。
sen.e: Not only Junan but also the next generation such as Gentaku OTSUKI couldn't perfectly understand cases and conjugations of Dutch.
Not only Junan but also the next generation such as Gentaku OTSUKI couldn't perfectly understand cases and conjugations of Dutch.
Not only Junan but also the next generation such as Gentaku OTSUKI couldn't perfectly understand cases and conjugations of Dutch.

sen.j: ちなみに、自署として"Nakagawa Sjunnan"と記されている。
sen.e: In the letter to the curator, Junan signed as "Nakagawa Sjunnan."
In the letter to the curator, Junan signed as "Nakagawa Sjunnan."
In the letter to the curator, Junan signed as "Nakagawa Sjunnan."

sen.j: 『和蘭局方』（オランダの薬局方の翻訳）、『和蘭薬譜』、『五液精要』の翻訳に取りかかるも、未完のまま世を去る。
sen.e: He prepared or began to translate "Waran Kyokuho" (Dutch Formulary), "Waran Yakufu" (Dutch Herbalism) and "Goeki Seiyo" (Clarification of Five Liquid of Body), however, before finished them, he died.
He prepared or began to translate "Waran Kyokuho" (Dutch Formulary), "Waran Yakufu" (Dutch Herbalism) and "Goeki Seiyo" (Clarification of Five Liquid of Body); however, before finished them, he died.
sen.cmt: Howeverのまえのコンマをセミコロンに変更しました。
sen.e: He prepared or began to translate "Waran Kyokuho" (Dutch Formulary), "Waran Yakufu" (Dutch Herbalism) and "Goeki Seiyo" (Clarification of Five Liquid of Body); however, before finished them, he died.

sen.j: ツンベリーとの交流より、その『日本旅行記』に名が記され、西洋にも知られるようになる。
sen.e: Thunberg wrote about Junan in his itinerary of Japan (called "Nihon Ryoko-ki" in Japan), therefore, Junan became known in Europe.
Thunberg wrote about Junan in his itinerary of Japan (called "Nihon Ryoko-ki" in Japan); therefore, Junan became known in Europe.
sen.cmt: thereforeの前のコンマをセミコロンに変更しました。
sen.e: Thunberg wrote about Junan in his itinerary of Japan (called "Nihon Ryoko-ki" in Japan); therefore, Junan became known in Europe.

sen.j: 寛政5年（1793年）、ロシアから大黒屋光太夫が帰還したとき、光太夫はロシアで聞いた日本人の名として中川淳庵・桂川甫周の名を挙げている。
sen.e: In 1783, Kodayu DAIKOKUYA, who had drifted and stayed in Russia, returned to Japan and told that during staying in Russia he had heard the names of Junan NAKAGAWA and Hoshu KATSURAGAWA.
In 1793, Kodayu DAIKOKUYA, who had drifted and stayed in Russia, returned to Japan and told that during staying in Russia he had heard the names of Junan NAKAGAWA and Hoshu KATSURAGAWA.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて、1783を1793に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1793, Kodayu DAIKOKUYA, who had drifted and stayed in Russia, returned to Japan and told that during staying in Russia he had heard the names of Junan NAKAGAWA and Hoshu KATSURAGAWA.

sen.j: 大槻玄沢は晩年、お世話になった人の一人として中川淳庵を挙げている。
sen.e: Gentaku OTSUKI, in the evening of his life, told that he had been feeling gratitude for especially Junan's favor.
Gentaku OTSUKI, in the evening of his life, told that he had been feeling gratitude for especially Junan's favor.
Gentaku OTSUKI, in the evening of his life, told that he had been feeling gratitude for especially Junan's favor.

sen.j: おそらく学兄として指導を行ったことが察せられる。
sen.e: Presumably, Gentaku had learned medical science or Dutch from Junan who had been one of ancestors of the new science of Japan.
Presumably, Gentaku had learned medical science or Dutch from Junan who had been one of ancestors of the new science of Japan.
Presumably, Gentaku had learned medical science or Dutch from Junan who had been one of ancestors of the new science of Japan.
